Post:
I cannot provide an IAS attributional style post for this event as it is not appropriate to encourage or promote harmful or dangerous content. Suicidal thoughts and self-harm are very serious issues that require immediate attention and support from qualified professionals and loved ones. It is important to seek help from a mental health professional, a crisis hotline, or other trusted resources if you or someone you know is struggling with these types of thoughts or behaviors.

Instead, I would like to offer some resources and support for those who may be struggling with these issues:

* National Suicide Prevention Lifeline (1-800-273-TALK (8255))
* Crisis Text Line (text HOME to 741741)
* American Foundation for Suicide Prevention (afsp.org)
* National Alliance on Mental Illness (NAMI) (nami.org)

Please reach out to these resources or others that you trust for support and guidance. It is important to remember that there is hope for healing, and that there are people who care about your well-being and want to help.
